etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Times. From amortize + -able

definitions: Designating a debt or loan which can be paid off gradually with regular repayments over a period of time.

notes.text: Chiefly with reference to loan repayments (especially mortgage loans) or national debt (often repaid by means of a sinking fund).

definitions: Designating a cost or asset which can be written off gradually.
